title: illumi_zoldyck
body:
A character from the [i][[Hunter x Hunter]][/i] series.

Born as the eldest son of the Zoldyck family, thus being [[Killua Zoldyck]]'s elder brother. He is currently the #11 of the Phantom Troupe, replacing the late [[Uvogin]] as per the request of his seemingly only friend, [[Hisoka Morow|Hisoka]]. During the Hunter Exam arc, he is initially known as "[[Gittarackur]]".

h4.Appearance
Illumi has [[long hair]], [[black eyes]], and a [[pale skin]]. As Gittarackur, Illumi has a much more sinister appearance, he had a long [[mohawk|blue mohawk]], numerous [[needle]]s pierced through his face.

title: tuna
body:
* !asset #21116781

Large oceanic species of [[fish]] from the tribe [b]Thunnini[/b] used as [[food]] and for recreational [[fishing]]. Their streamlined bodies and retractable crescent-shaped fins are adaptations for fast swimming. A very popular and cheap food worldwide, Japan is the second largest tuna producer and consumer in the world.

This fish is often associated with the [[Vocaloid]] [[Megurine Luka]] and the character [[Kiana Kaslana]].

h4. See also

* [[sushi]]

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Tuna":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tuna

title: pinstriping
body: Pin striping is the application of a very thin line of paint or other material called a pin stripe, and is generally used for decoration. Freehand pin stripers use a specialty brush known as a pinstriping brush. Fine lines in textiles are also called pinstripes.

title: ditto_(newjeans)
body:
A 2022 song by [[NewJeans]], noted for it's Baltimore Club-inspired style. The song was massively successful, winning multiple awards and topping the charts in South Korea and several other Asian regions.

The song has two music videos, both of which portray the group as high school students recording their lives using a [[camcorder]], with an unnamed 6th girl as their camerawoman. In the videos they wear a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[brown jacket|brown]] [[blazer]], a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], and a [[blue skirt]].

h4. External Links
* "YouTube: NewJeans (뉴진스) 'Ditto' Official MV (side A)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pSUydWEqKwE]
* "YouTube: NewJeans (뉴진스) 'Ditto' Official MV (side B)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V37TaRdVUQY]

title: time_paradox
body:
A chronologically impossible scenario, such as a character meeting their older or younger self, or two characters from different time periods meeting, even if one of them should be dead or shouldn't be born yet.

For example: [[Asahina Mikuru]] meeting [[Asahina Mikuru (adult)|adult Mikuru]], [[Revolver Ocelot]] meeting Major Ocelot, or [[Altair Ibn la-Ahad|Altair]] meeting [[Desmond Miles]].

h4. See also

title: intestines_filled
body:
[[Intestines]] filled is usually used for organisms like [[tentacles]] or items like [[anal beads]] entering the digestive tract through the mouth or anus, filling the entire intestine. It is commonly accompanied by [[all the way through]].

The term is used to denote abdominal bloating caused by the filling of the intestines specifically, and should not be confused with [[inflation]] or [[stomach bulge]].

title: one_world_trade_center
body:
The replacement for the [[World Trade Center]] that was destroyed by the terrorist attacks on [[9/11|September 11, 2001]]. Formerly called the Freedom Tower. 

The building was opened in 2014 and is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere. It is located near where the original Twin Towers once stood.

title: stomach_bulge
body:
A visible protrusion of the stomach caused when something (usually a [[penis]], [[tentacles]], etc.) pushes against the stomach from the inside.  Like [[cervical penetration]], it is impossible to occur in reality without fatal damage.

If the bulging of the stomach is caused by the stomach filling up with something (usually a fluid), it is called [[inflation]].

h4. See also

* [[large insertion]]
* [[full stomach]]
* [[deep penetration]]
* [[intestines filled]]

title: crisis_moon_compact
body:
The [[heart brooch]] that [[Super Sailor Moon]] uses to transform in all iterations of the fourth season of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. [[tsukino usagi|Usagi]] and [[Chibi Usa]] (with her Chibi Moon Compact) both shout "Moon Crisis, Make Up" to morph into their Sailor Senshi identities. This is the only transformation sequence in the series that involves two characters simultaneously.

You want to be able to see the brooch's details up close to make sure it's not a different type of compact that Sailor Moon uses. If you cannot see what it is, or it's drawn so far away that it's rendered as a generic brooch, don't use this tag. It is especially difficult to tell this and her [[Cosmic Heart Compact]] apart from far away, but the easiest difference is that this has gold wings on the heart's sides whereas the other doesn't.

The compact "looks like this":https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/sailormoon/images/2/24/A-crisis-moon-compact.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120322220828 when up close.

h4.See also

* [[Transformation Brooch (sailor moon)|]] (1st season)
* [[Crystal Star (sailor moon)|]] (2nd season)
* [[Cosmic Heart Compact]] (3rd season)
* [[Eternal Moon Article]] (5th season)

title: crystal_star_(sailor_moon)
body:
The circular brooch that [[Sailor Moon]] uses to transform in all iterations of the second season of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. She shouts "Moon Crystal Power, Make Up" to transform.

This particular brooch is easy to tell from a distance since it's the only one that has a star as its primary shape. Even so, you want to be able to see the brooch's details up close to make sure it's not a different type of compact that Sailor Moon uses. If you cannot see what it is, or it's drawn so far away that it's rendered as a generic brooch, don't use this tag.

The brooch "looks like this":https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/sailormoon/images/0/0c/Ajiaoidjgao.png/revision/latest?cb=20111023205502 when up close.

h4.See also

* [[Transformation Brooch (sailor moon)|]] (1st season)
* [[Cosmic Heart Compact]] (3rd season)
* [[Crisis Moon Compact]] (4th season)
* [[Eternal Moon Article]] (5th season)

title: transformation_brooch_(sailor_moon)
body:
The circular [[brooch]] that [[Sailor Moon]] uses to transform in all iterations of the first season of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. She shouts "Moon Prism Power, Make Up" to transform. 

There are actually two distinct designs for this brooch; "one":https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/sailormoon/images/e/ea/Tumblr_nyho9o9tnC1qjkedbo5_1280.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160927125923 from the manga and [[bishoujo senshi sailor moon crystal|Crystal]], and the "other":https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/sailormoon/images/3/3f/48.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200601141704 from the 90s anime. Both are designed with a crescent in the center, circled by four colored gems representing the four [[Inner Senshi]] who protect her.

You want to be able to see the brooch's details up close to make sure it's not a different type of compact that Sailor Moon uses. If you cannot see what it is, or it's drawn so far away that it's rendered as a generic brooch, don't use this tag.

h4.See also

* [[Crystal Star (sailor moon)|]] (2nd season)
* [[Cosmic Heart Compact]] (3rd season)
* [[Crisis Moon Compact]] (4th season)
* [[Eternal Moon Article]] (5th season)

title: yuyusu_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21104606
* !asset #21104607

Voice of [[Ibuki Suika]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Gorgonzola☆]], the artist / [[Hakurei Reimu]] and Sunny Milk (as [[Shiriri Saikyo]]) and Izayoi Sakuya (as [[Ein (cookie)|]]) in [[cookie (touhou)|Self Contradiction☆]], and as Maria in Kussoo☆☆☆☆☆☆. Identifiable by her [[arms up]] pose as Suika, her [[very long hair|very long]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[black hair|black]] and [[grey hair]] with [[low twintails]] in a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[red dress]] as Reimu. She had a very distinctive high-pitched voice and speech pattern and frequently did live chats with [[Mochiya (cookie)|]] and [[Kinu (cookie)|]]. She was a fairly active artist too, but in January 2020 she said her step-father found out about her voice acting and told her to stop, including her brief stint as the vtuber Kuesu Hatena.

Her most common depictions are her roles in Self-Contradiction☆ but the sub-characters have been split off into their own articles here so this tag is just for her main appearances as Suika and Reimu. Self-Contradiction☆ being a massively important voice drama made her into one of the most popular Cookie voice actors of the later part of the fandom, even if it aired after she disappeared. Most of her appearances in fan art focus on her role as the fame-desperate artist. 

However, people began to suspect she was lying about her step-father telling her to stop. In March 2020, a [[Sugar Lyric]] [[virtual Youtuber]] named [[Shishio Chris]] debuted with a suspiciously similar voice, a love of twitcasting, lots of merch of Yokohama DeNA Baystars, and a familiarity with vtubing. Within 2 days Cookie fans had all but confirmed that it was her.

title: crescent_compact_(sailor_moon)
body: A crescent-shaped brooch that [[Artemis (sailor moon)|]] gives [[Aino Minako]] in [[Codename wa Sailor V]], and continues to be used occasionally in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. It doesn't have an official name beyond [b]Compact[/b], so it goes by the fan name [b]Crescent Compact[/b] to differentiate it from the various brooches that [[Sailor Moon]] uses. It gives [[Sailor V]]/[[Sailor Venus]] the ability to use various attacks, as well as to don a disguise.

title: disguise_pen_(sailor_moon)
body:
A pink pen with a red crystal on top. [[Luna (sailor moon)|]] gives this to [[tsukino usagi|Usagi]] so she can don a disguise to infiltrate places she normally cannot access. [[Sailor Venus]] uses it once (offscreen) to transform into a mock version of [[Sailor Moon]] to trick the enemy in the 90s anime's third season.

Not to be confused with the [[Transformation Pen]]s that the [[Inner Senshi]] use to transform into their Sailor identities.

title: transformation_pen
body:
Item in [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]], used for the [[Inner Senshi]] to [[henshin|transform]] into their [[Sailor Senshi]] identities in the first season. It appears as a pen-sized stick colored in each girl's theme colors and has an orb bearing their respective planetary symbol.

Not to be confused with the [[Disguise Pen (sailor moon)|]] that Usagi uses.

title: izumi_(izumi_and_the_dragon_book)
body:
The titular character Izumi is one of the main protagonists of the manga series [[Izumi and the Dragon Book]].

She is a serious and diligent editor and a low-level troubadour working for the publishing company "[i]Sword&Friend Company's second editorial department[/i]", tasked with the job of revising their masterpiece "The Dragon Book". She was afflicted by the curse of a dragon which left her with a small stature despite her mature age.

title: cosmic_heart_compact
body:
The [[heart brooch]] that [[Sailor Moon]] uses in all iterations of the third season of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. She shouts, "Moon Cosmic Power, Make Up" to transform, and she gains slight modifications to her uniform such as wing-shaped hairpins and a [[red choker|red]] [[heart choker]]. It retains the same design when she temporarily powers up into [[Super Sailor Moon]].

You want to be able to see the brooch's details up close to make sure it's not a different type of compact that Sailor Moon uses. If you cannot see what it is, or it's drawn so far away that it's rendered as a generic brooch, don't use this tag. It is especially difficult to tell this and her [[Crisis Moon Compact]] apart from far away, but the easiest difference is that the latter has gold wings on the heart's sides whereas this doesn't.

The brooch "looks like this":https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/sailormoon/images/b/bb/Brosh3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110808102025 when up close.

h4.See also

title: star_locket_(sailor_moon)
body: An item only seen in the 90s version of [[Bishoujo Senshi Sailor Moon]]. A star-shaped locket that [[Chiba Mamoru]] first owns, then gives to [[Tsukino Usagi]]. Originally, [[Princess Serenity]] gave it to [[Endymion (sailor moon)|Prince Endymion]] during the Silver Millennium 1000 years ago. It plays a lullaby version of [i]Moonlight Densetsu[/i], and helps [[Sailor Moon]] purify Mamoru from his corruption by [[Queen Beryl]].

title: titan_(shingeki_no_kyojin)
body:
The main antagonists of the manga and anime series [[Shingeki no Kyojin]] [spoiler]at least until the chapter and episode "The Basement", where real enemies, the Marleyan Empire, were revealed[/spoiler]. They are [[giant]] humanoid, nearly unkillable creatures, having hunted and devoured humanity till near-extinction[spoiler]. Which was revealed to be a lie in the above-mentioned chapter and episode, where it was also revealed that they are in fact a race of humans called "Eldians" that can transform into a giant form at will, and thus they were oppressed and eventually isolated inside the Paradis island by the Marleyans. Who spread the lie about the Eldian's origin to have them (i.e. those inside the walled cities) eventually killed each other out[/spoiler].


h4. Types:

* [[Armored Titan]] 
* [[Beast Titan]]
* [[Cart Titan]]
* [[Colossal Titan]]
* [[Female Titan]]
* [[Founding Titan]]
* [[Titan_(generic)_(shingeki_no_kyojin)|Generic Titan]] [spoiler](Pure Titan)[/spoiler]

** [[Flying Jaw Titan]]
* [[Rogue Titan]] [spoiler] (Attack Titan)[/spoiler]
* [[War Hammer Titan]]
* [spoiler][[Ymir Fritz]][/spoiler]

title: candy_candy_(series)
body:
A [[1970s_(style)|70s]] shoujo series starring a young girl named Candice "Candy" White Ardlay, who is a [[blonde hair|blonde]] American girl with [[freckles]], large emerald [[green eyes]] and long and [[curly hair]], worn in [[twintails]] with [[bow]]s.

Story by Mizuki Kyoko, and artwork by [[Igarashi Yumiko]].

Outside of Japan the series anime adaptation was quite popular in Latin America, specially in [[Mexico]], [[Chile]] and [[Argentina]] during 1978 and the early [[1980s_(style)|80s]]. The Spanish dub of Candy by Argentine voice actress "Cecilia 'Pelusa' Gispert":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KJBHTRYW2xw became extremely popular in the region during that era.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Candy Candy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Candy_Candy
other_names: キャンディ・キャンディ
キャンディキャンディ

title: cassidy_(overwatch)
body:
Playable character in [[Overwatch 2]], first introduced in [[Overwatch 1]]. Cassidy is a sci-fi cowboy from the wild west. He was originally a gang member, but was imprisoned by Overwatch and later recruited into their covert ops wing Blackwatch under the tutelage of [[reaper_(overwatch)|Gabriel Reyes]]. 

Formerly named "Jesse McCree" after one of the former developers who was involved in a sexual harassment lawsuit at Blizzard Entertainment. As of October 22, 2021, his new official name is now "Cole Cassidy":https://twitter.com/PlayOverwatch/status/1451624387732512770 (displayed as "Cassidy" in-game).

h4. Alternate skins

title: tech_2_ship_(eve_online)
body:
A type of [[spacecraft|spaceships]] from the [[EVE Online]].

These ships are only manufactured by players through the Invention process. They are usually comparable in price to [[Navy faction (EVE Online)|]] ships while being more powerful, but have high skill requirements to use. As well as better performance and bonuses, T2 ships have increased damage resistance, making them tougher. Additionally, many (but not all) Tech 2 ships are more specialised than their Tech 1 counterparts. An example of a Tech 2 frigate is the Wolf, a Tech 2 [[Minmatar Republic (EVE Online)|Minmatar]] [[Assault ship (EVE Online)|Assault]] [[frigate (EVE Online)|]] based on the [[Rifter (EVE Online)|]].

h5. External links: 
https://wiki.eveuniversity.org/Tech_and_meta_levels#Tech_2_3

title: hanazaki_saki
body:
Side character in [[Bacchikoi!]]. She is Yakyusha Academy's homeroom teacher.

After her relentless search for a job in newspapers and advertisements, Yanai Keiji, father of [[Yanai Ichiru]] and president of Yakyusha Academy, offers her a job as a teacher, to which she accepted.

title: fumei_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21106401

Voice of [[Maribel Hearn]] and [[fumei unknown|artist]] of [[cookie (touhou)|Marisa and Alice's Self Contradiction☆]], also doing art for Viet Cong☆ and Half-life☆. Began as an artist in 2016 and then completely abandoned Cookie following Self Contradiction☆, although it has been confirmed that he now is drawing on another account (very likely to be [[chuhaibane]] and [[un-known_(ninesix)]]). Reportedly likes [[leftame]]'s art. 

In fan art he is depicted as either [[Jiko Mujun]]'s friend or victim.

title: fumei_unknown

title: jiko_mujun
body:
* !asset #21106115
* !asset #21106111
* !asset #21106113

Director, animator, editor, and voice of [[Usami Renko]] of his self-titled [[cookie (touhou)|Marisa and Alice's Self Contradiction☆]]. Previously a well-respected MAD maker best known for creating [[Metal Hisui (cookie)|]], he was later leaked to be [[xxx_(nicoseiga530226)|]]. Arguably the most controversial director since [[Hazuna Rio]], as Self Contradiction☆ created a massive upheaval in the Cookie community with crossing accusations of fame, purpose, and what was even the point of Cookie anymore. 

After abandoning his old art account in 2014, he began slowly making MADs in 2015. He liked [[Asatsuki (cookie)|]] and was uniquely good at animation for a MAD maker, but contemporaries noticed that he was hard to contact as he almost never checked DMs. Self Contradiction☆ is a partly autobiographical work of both his and [[Fumei (cookie)|]]'s experiences in the Cookie community that he started writing in 2018. When it was released in 2020 it instantly became the most controversial voice drama since the original, as it was an extremely harsh critique of every aspect of the community. Both antis and supporters of the drama began attacking each other and him, and he ended up being accused of chasing fame himself and got doxxed at his appearance at a small art festival in Lisbon, Portugal.

title: mishou_kazuya_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21105952

Director of [[cookie (touhou)|Kasu☆]] and semi-professional musician. Originally wanted to do BGM for [[Taisa (cookie)|]] if she made another voice drama, but became a director after Taisa confirmed her retirement. His arrogance before and after his voice drama was released led to a lot of negative impressions of him, and people accused him of just chasing the fame of Cookie☆. Even though he had said he was retiring from Cookie☆  afterwards, he did one more livestream with [[Eska (cookie)|]], so her fans got mad and insulted him again.

To this day he is mostly considered to be a bad director, doing Cookie☆ for the fame. Depending on who you ask either him or [[Maki (cookie)|]], the failed director, were the beginnings of the pessimism of the Cookie community.

title: agucala_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21105161
* !post #4601070

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Pepe☆]], [[Yakumo Yukari]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]] and Luna Child (as [[Riran Youkyu]]), 2019 [[Kochiya Sanae]] in Kuso☆☆☆☆☆☆. Her appearance as a [[dark-skinned female|dark-skinned]] Reimu with [[white gloves|white]] [[ribbon-trimmed gloves|ribbon-trimmed]] [[elbow gloves]], and [[no pants ]] is her most famous appearance, despite Pepe☆ generally being unremarkable. While playing a major role in Self-Contradiction☆, her depictions as Yukari and Marisa are less common. She has a very noticeable nasal lisp. 

The appearance of her dark-skinned Reimu and awkward speech made people joke that she was Filipino. Seems to be fairly unstable in their accounts, creating and deleting multiple YouTube and twitter accounts.

title: shunga_youkyu
body:
* !asset #21105512

Geru Futota as the voice of [[Star Sapphire]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Self-Contradiction☆]], split off due to having her own character interactions. Her name was given to her by her lines saying asking [[Yuyusu (cookie)|]] to draw [[shunga]] for her (youkyu means request). Wears a [[purple bow|purple]] [[hair bow]] with a [[hime cut]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[purple jacket]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], [[star earrings]],  and a [[black ribbon|black]] [[neck ribbon]]. 

By far the most popular member of the trio, her request for shunga led her to having a lot of pornographic drawings, especially as Cookie's first real [[mesugaki]]. Even became a mildly popular [[yukkuri_shiteitte_ne|yukkuri]] by the name of Shunshun. Naturally grouped with the other members of her trio, [[Riran Youkyu]] and [[Shiriri Saikyo]].

title: kinky_hair
body:
Kinky hair, also called afro-textured or type 4 hair, is hair that grows in small, tightly coiled curls. 
In real life, this hair type is common in people indigenous to areas with hot climates, especially Africa. 
It can be styled many ways, such as [[afro]]s, [[cornrows]], [[dreadlocks]].

title: zerukalo_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21104428
* !asset #21104429

Voice of [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] and [[Moriya Suwako]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso☆☆☆☆☆]], [[Konpaku Youmu]] in Onsen☆, [[Yorigami Shion]] in Gorgonzola☆. Her appearance in Kuso☆☆☆☆☆ went basically completely unnoticed, was the breakout star in the completely unremarkable Onsen☆, and achieved peak popularity in Gorgonzola☆. She's gone by several names but settled on зеркало (mirror in Russian). 

Started voice acting around 12 years old in 2013 but her frequent name changes made her blend in with the vast amount of other wannabes and didn't get any parts until 2015. Her appearance in Onsen☆ as the [[heterochromia|heterochromatic]] Youmu who digs the onsen with a combination [[shovel]] and [[pickaxe]] first started giving her fan art. This was then followed by her main role as Shion in Gorgonzola☆ where her pitiful appearance and role had people sympathize with her. This was also compounded by the discovery that when she was connected with one of her previous names that admitted she was living in government poverty housing when she first started looking for roles.

title: mugi_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21103966

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|SpeCa☆]]. The only Reimu to have [[purple hair]] and a [[blue ascot]] and white [[hair tubes]] largely because of restrictions that were suddenly placed on the MMD model, so people started drawing fan art closer to PC98 Reimu. Like [[Kinu (cookie)|]] they originally pretended to be a woman but later admitted that he was a man. Was slightly jealous of how easily Kinu was able to have a feminine voice. 

While Kinu's admission of being a man was surprising and definitive, Mugi kept his gender relatively ambiguous for almost all of 2017, switching between male and female pronouns. This led to a lot of confusion over his gender since he had not released a video of his natural speaking voice yet, becoming the only voice actor to be called -aneki-aniki (姉貴兄貴). In 2018 he would release a video of his actual voice and go inactive. Was a fan of [[Senjougahara Hitagi]].

h4. External links
* YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/@Mugi_Ch

title: foreshortening
body: Foreshortening is the effect that an object is pointing at the viewer, by making it "shorter" than it really is (and usually enlarging the object). Getting this right is one of the "holy grails" of artists. Technically, all drawings that include the illusion of depth have foreshortening, so only use this tag if the foreshortening is a strong element of the image. Not to be confused with [[depth of field]], which refers to blurry, out-of-focus portions of an image. An image can contain both, but not necessarily. Examples of foreshortening without [[depth of field]]: * !post #6795996 * !post #705217 Examples of foreshortening with [[depth of field]]: * !post #385277: [[depth of field]] in the foreground * !post #5749171: [[depth of field]] in the background h4. See also * [[fisheye]] * [[perspective]] * [[Tag group:Image Composition]]

title: product_12_(nikke)
body:
A playable character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. One of the [[mass-produced Nikke]]s manufactured by Missilis Industry.

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[brown hair]] and face covered by a [[visor]]. She wears a [[military uniform]] consisting of [[brown shirt]], [[body armor]], [[backpack]], and [[belt pouch]]. She is always seen [[holding gun|carrying]] a [[machine gun]].

Product 12 gain more prominence in the [[NieR:Automata]] crossover event "[i]OuteR: Automata[/i]," notably the four Product 12s with various nicknames all summoned by the Tyrant-class [[Rapture (nikke)|]] known as Gatekeeper via the D-Wave event:

* [b]P-12[/b] - a Product 12 seen accompanying [[A2 (nier:automata)|]]. Despite A2's reluctant trust to her due to being an outsider from an another world, P-12 still gives her best to help A2 in their folly.
* [b]C-1002[/b] - a Product 12 encountered by [[Counters (nikke)|]], she was known as "Lively Product 12." C-1002 took their code-names from a spy movie they watched alongside her company.
* [b]B-0006[/b] - a Product 12 known as "Cautious Product 12." She shows genuine concern over her fellow Product 12s, replicant or not. Wanting nothing more than peace and coexistence amongst all mass-produced models due to the D-Wave event, unable to bear the conflict amongst each other. [spoiler]She was eventually killed by 6000-D for this.[/spoiler]
* [b]6-000D[/b] - a Product 12 known as "Taciturn Product 12." She is actually the event's main antagonist.

Original artist: [[dduck kong]].

title: scissors
body:
Scissors are hand-operated cutting instruments. They consist of a pair of metal blades that is connected in such a way that the sharpened edges slide against each other. Scissors are used for cutting various thin materials, such as paper, cardboard, metal foil, thin plastic, cloth, rope and wire.

h4. See also
* [[clippers]]
* [[shears]]

title: rapture_(nikke)
body:
Raptures are the main antagonists of [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]].

Quasi-mechanical beings whose origins are unknown, they proved hostile and highly resistant to conventional weapons. The resulting military defeat would drive humanity literally underground. Raptures commonly range in size from a small car to skyscraper-sized monstrosities and can only be destroyed with the weapons Nikkes use.
other_names: ラプチャー(勝利の女神:NIKKE)

title: huban
body:
In ancient China, the sign held by officials when attending court was called "Hu Ban," also known as "Shou Ban," "Yu Ban," or "Chao Ban." It was a tool used by ancient Chinese subjects when facing the emperor.

In ancient times, when Chinese civil and military officials met the emperor, they held the Hu Ban in both hands to record the emperor's orders or intentions. They could also write down what they wanted to report to the emperor on the Hu Ban to prevent forgetting.

Officials of the fifth rank or higher held ivory Hu Ban, while officials of the sixth rank or lower held Hu Ban made of bamboo or wood. In the Ming Dynasty, it was stipulated that officials of the fifth rank or higher should hold ivory Hu Ban, while officials of the fifth rank or lower did not hold Hu Ban. Since the Qing Dynasty in China, the use of Hu Ban has been discontinued and abandoned.

title: defense_of_the_ancients
body:
[b]Defense of the Ancients[/b] (commonly known as [b]DotA[/b]) is a custom scenario for the real-time strategy game [[Warcraft III]] that became extremely popular. Valve would later buy the rights to DotA and create a sequel called [[Dota 2]] and a [[Dota (series)|series]].

The objective of the scenario is for each team to destroy the opponents' Ancients, heavily guarded structures at opposing corners of the map. Players are a part of a team of five, using powerful units known as Heroes and assisted by AI-controlled fighters called Creeps. 

h4. See also

* [[League of Legends]]
* [[Heroes of the Storm]]
* [[Heroes of Newerth]]

title: dota_2
body:
[i]DotA 2[/i] is an strategy video game developed by Valve Corporation. It is the sequel to the popular [i][[Warcraft III]] [/i] mod [i][[Defense of the Ancients]][/i], and the first entry in the Valve-run [[DotA (series)|]] franchise.

The game consists of session-based online multiplayer activity, with the primary objective of each match being for the teams to destroy their opposing team's fortified stronghold. Each player controls a player character called a "hero", who is given the responsibility of participating in team combat, which generally takes place along a series of lanes that connect their opposing bases, lined with defensive towers.

The brand known as Supreme Italia is a [i]legal fake[/i], an unrelated company that registers a known brand in another country before the original company, of Supreme New York, can. title: airbus_a350
body:
A long-range twin-engine wide-body airliner made by [b][[Airbus]][/b] in Toulouse, [[France]], which entered service in 2013 with Qatar Airways as its launch customer. It is the primary competitor with [[boeing|Boeing's]] [[boeing 787|787 Dreamliner]], featuring similar characteristics such as a lightweight composite fuselage, fuel-efficient high-bypass [[jet engine|turbofan engines]], a digital [[cockpit]], and improved cabin pressurization. Newer models also include electronically-dimming windows in lieu on pull-down window shades.

The A350-900ULR (Ultra-Long Range) variant has the longest range of any commercial airliner in service in the world at 9700 nm (17,900 km), which has resulted in it being used on the world's (current) longest commercial flight from [[New York City]] to [[Singapore]], taking 18 hours and 30 minutes. [[Qantas]] has selected a modified variant of the A350-1000 to be used on its upcoming [i]Project Sunrise[/i] route from [[Sydney]] to New York and [[London]], both flights upwards of 19 hours. [[Japan Airlines]] is also currently taking deliveries of the A350-1000 as its new long-haul flagship, replacing  the [[boeing 777|Boeing 777-300ER]]. 

Although the aircraft has a near-perfect safety record, it has had one hull loss--in "January 2024":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_Haneda_Airport_runway_collision]--when a JAL A350-900 collided with a [[Japan Coast Guard]] De Havilland Dash 8 on the runway of [[Haneda Airport]] in [[tokyo (city)|Tokyo]], resulting in the complete destruction of both aircraft. However investigations concluded that the incident was caused by a miscommunication with air traffic control rather than mechanical failure.
h4. See also

* [[List of airplanes]]
* [[boeing 787|Boeing 787 Dreamliner]], the A350's main competitor

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Airbus A350":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airbus_A350

title: new_york_city_police_department
body:
The primary law enforcement agency responsible for maintaining public safety and enforcing laws within the five boroughs of New York City. It is one of the largest police departments operating in the [[United States]]. The NYPD is headed by a Police Commissioner and operates under the jurisdiction of the City of [[New York City]].

The department's main responsibilities include preventing and investigating crime, responding to emergency calls, conducting patrols, maintaining public order, traffic control, and providing various community services. The NYPD also plays a vital role in counterterrorism efforts and works closely with other local, state, and federal agencies to ensure the safety and security of New York City residents and visitors.

The NYPD is organized into numerous precincts, detective squads, specialized units, and divisions to address different aspects of law enforcement. It employs police officers, detectives, administrative staff, and other personnel to carry out its duties and responsibilities.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: New York City Police Department":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City_Police_Department]
* "Official NYPD website":[https://www.nyc.gov/site/nypd/index.page]

h4. See Also
* [[Police]]

title: the_godfather
body:
The Godfather is a 1972 American crime film directed by Francis Ford Coppola and produced by Albert S. Ruddy from a screenplay by Mario Puzo and Coppola. Starring Marlon Brando and Al Pacino as the leaders of a fictional [[New York City]] crime family, the story spans the years 1945-55, centering on the transformation of Michael Corleone from reluctant family outsider to ruthless Mafia boss while chronicling the Corleones under the patriarch [[Vito Corleone|Vito]].

h4.External Links:

* "Wikipedia: The Godfather":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Godfather
* "IMDb: The Godfather":https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0068646/

title: gretsch
body:
American [[instrument]] maker founded in 1883 in Brooklyn, [[New York City]] by German immigrant Friedrich Gretsch. While starting with [[banjo]]s [[tambourine]]s and [[drum]]s, the Gretch that is known today is most famously known for their hollow-body [[electric guitar]]s followed by its line of [i]Jet[/i] solid-body [[bass guitar]]s and electric guitars.
The name Gretsch starded gaining rapid success and popularity in the [[guitar]] market with the introduction of their now instantly recognisable large-scale hollow-body guitars in the mid and late 1950s with the growing success of the Country, Rockabily and Rock n' Roll in general as opposed to its relative competitors [[fender_musical_instruments_corporation|Fender]], [[gibson_brands_inc|Gibson]] and [[Rickenbacker]] being popular in more alternative (and often heavier) forms of music.

Use this tag when the brand name/logo is depicted in either the [[commentary]] or the image itself.

title: patrick_bateman
body:
A fictional character created by American writer Bret Easton Ellis. Bateman is the focus of Ellis's 1991 novel "[[American Psycho]]," set in [[new york city|New York City]] during the 1980s. 

Patrick Bateman is depicted as a wealthy and narcissistic investment banker. He leads a double life as a sadistic serial killer, indulging in extreme violence and exhibiting psychopathic tendencies. 

The character gained significant attention and controversy due to the graphic and disturbing nature of his actions. The novel was later adapted into a film in 2000, with [[Christian Bale]] portraying the character.

Patrick Bateman's character has maintained a strong presence in contemporary [[meme]] culture due to his perceived "sigma" personality.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Patrick Bateman":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Patrick_Bateman]
* "Wikipedia: American Psycho":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho]
* "Wikipedia: American Psycho (film)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Psycho_(film)]

h4. See Also
* [[American Psycho]]

title: taxi_driver
body:
[i]You talkin' to me?[/i]

An American psychological thriller film by Martin Scorsese. 

It follows [[Travis Bickle]], a [[Vietnam]] veteran who becomes a [[taxi]] driver in [[New York City]], and then descends into insanity, as he plots to assassinate a prsidental candidate and the pimp of an underage [[prostitute]] he befriended.

title: manhattan
body:
One of the five boroughs of [[new york city|New York City]] and is often considered the most well-known and iconic of the five. It is an island bordered by the "Hudson River":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hudson_River to the west, the "East River":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_River to the east, and separated from the mainland by various bridges and tunnels. 

Home to several prominent neighborhoods and landmarks, Manhattan is a significant hub for finance, commerce, culture, and tourism. Some of its famous neighborhoods include "Midtown Manhattan":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midtown_Manhattan, which houses iconic places like [[Times Square]], "Broadway theaters":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Broadway_(Manhattan), and numerous skyscrapers; the "Upper East Side":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Upper_East_Side and "Upper West Side":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Upper_West_Side known for their residential areas and cultural institutions like the "Metropolitan Museum of Art":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_Museum_of_Art and the "American Museum of Natural History":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Museum_of_Natural_History, respectively; and downtown districts like the "Financial District":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Financial_District,_Manhattan, which includes [[Wall Street]] and [[One World Trade Center]].

"Central Park":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Park, one of the most famous urban parks in the world, spans a significant portion of Manhattan's midsection. Manhattan's neighborhoods showcase a blend of historic architecture, modern skyscrapers, cultural diversity, and a vibrant social scene, making it a bustling and diverse area within New York City.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Manhattan":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manhattan]
* "Wikipedia: Boroughs in New York City":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boroughs_of_New_York_City]
* "Wikipedia: New York City":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City]

title: world_trade_center
body:
A large complex of seven [[building]]s in the Financial District of Lower Manhattan in [[New York City]] [[City]] that originally stood from 1973 to 2001. More often referred to as the [b]Twin Towers[/b], in reference to its two tallest buildings, a pair of landmark buildings that stood there. The center was targeted as part of a terrorist attack on [[9/11|September 11, 2001]], leading to the destruction of the Twin Towers.

A new complex was built on the site of the old one, including such sites as the National September 11 Memorial and buildings as the [[One World Trade Center]].

h1. See also
* [[skyscraper]]
* [[Tag Group:Real World Locations]]

title: daisy_hills
body: The second track in the Mushroom Cup in [[Mario Kart 7]]. The track, whose name alludes to [[Princess Daisy]], is located in a village surrounded by green [[hill]]s, [[mountain]]s, and [[flower field|fields of flowers]], and [[goat]]s can be seen in certain parts of the track. It strongly resembles the [[Austria]]n landscape. It reappears in the [[Mario Kart Tour]], starting with the [[New York City]] Tour.

title: miguel_o'hara
body:
A fictional character in the [[Marvel]] universe. He first appeared in 1992 as the superhero [[Spider-Man (2099)|Spider-Man 2099]]. 

Miguel O'Hara is a geneticist working for the mega-corporation Alchemax in a future version of [[new york city|New York City]] called Nueva York. After an accident, Miguel undergoes a genetic transformation to acquire spider-like abilities similar to the original [[Spider-Man]], including enhanced strength, agility, and the ability to stick to walls. As Spider-Man 2099, Miguel fights crime and corruption in the dystopian future, often facing challenges unique to his time period. 

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Spider-Man 2099":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spider-Man_2099]

title: new_york_city_fire_department
body:
The primary fire and emergency services agency for the City of [[New York City]]. It is one of the largest and busiest fire departments in the [[United States]]. The FDNY is responsible for responding to and mitigating various emergencies, including fires, medical emergencies, hazardous material incidents, and rescues.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: New York City Fire Department":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_City_Fire_Department]
* "FDNY official website":[https://www.nyc.gov/site/fdny/index.page]

title: christ_the_redeemer
body:
[b]Christ the Redeemer[/b] (Portuguese: [i]Cristo Redentor[/i]) is a 30-meter-high concrete [[Art Deco]] [[statue]] of [[Jesus|Christ]] that stands atop the [[Brazil|Brazilian]] mountain Corcovado, overlooking the city of [[Rio de Janeiro]].

Christ the Redeemer's distinctive look and dramatic setting have made it an icon of the city since its completion in 1931. An artist wanting to establish that an image involves Rio has only to include it in the background somewhere, in much the same way that, for instance, the [[Eiffel Tower]] instantly evokes [[Paris]], or the [[Statue of Liberty]] does [[New York City]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Christ the Redeemer":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christ_the_Redeemer_(statue)]

title: elisabeth_von_wettin
body: One of the main characters of [[Ido e Itaru Mori e Itaru Ido]] and [[Maerchen (sound horizon)|]]. She has blonde hair and a ponytail, and she wears a white dress. When adding her tag, be sure that it is actually her and not [[Elyse (sound horizon)|]] - Elyse is a doll that looks like Elisabeth, and she wears a red and black dress.

title: buranko_(marchen)
body: An unnamed girl from [[Maerchen (sound horizon)|]]'s third track. She was nicknamed Buranko (swing girl) because she died on the gallows. She has [[brown hair]] and [[twintails]], and she wears a [[headdress]] and a [[black dress|black]] and [[orange dress]].

title: alte_rose
body:
Alte Rose is the antagonist in the song Bara no Tou de Nemuru Himegimi from [[Sound Horizon]]'s [[Maerchen (sound horizon)|]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with her [[hair over one eye|bangs covering her left eye]]. She is garbed in a [[cloak]] with a [[striped dress|striped]] [[black dress]] beneath suited by a [[belt]], also donning [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] (sometimes drawn as [[fingerless gloves]]).

It's implied she is Crimson Old Rose, the woman who raised [[Lafrenze]].

title: dornroschen
body: A character from [[Maerchen (sound horizon)|]]'s sixth track. Her name means Briar Rose in German. She has blonde hair and wears a pink dress.

title: aohigeko
body: An unnamed woman from [[Maerchen (sound horizon)|]]'s seventh track. She is nicknamed Aohigeko because she is the wife of Bluebeard (Aohige). She has black hair and wears a white and green dress.

title: tettere
body: An unnamed character from [[Maerchen (sound horizon)|]]'s fourth and sixth tracks. He was nicknamed Tettere after a sound effect that appears when he enters a scene. He has [[blonde hair]] and wears a [[red cape|red]] and/or [[blue cape]].

title: nun_(marchen)
body: A unnamed nun from [[Maerchen (sound horizon)|]]'s second track. She has brown hair and wears a habit.

title: marchen_von_friedhof
body: A noble man with dark hair, usually in a low ponytail - the main character in [[Maerchen (sound horizon)|]].

title: idoko
body: An unnamed girl from [[Maerchen (sound horizon)|]]'s fifth track. She was nicknamed Idoko because she died in a well (ido). She has [[blonde hair]] and [[twin braids]] and wears a [[green dress]] with an [[apron]].

title: schneewittchen
body: A character from [[Maerchen (sound horizon)|]]'s fourth track. Her name means Snow White in German. She has [[black hair]] and wears a [[crown]] and a [[blue dress|blue]] and [[white dress]].

title: maerchen_(sound_horizon)
body:
Märchen is an album released by [[Sound Horizon]]. It features different takes on some of [[Grimm's Fairy Tales]], such as [[Hansel and Gretel]], [[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs]], [[Sleeping Beauty]], as well as lesser known fairy tales. The [[seven deadly sins]] are also incorporated into the stories.

title: don_quixote_(fate)
body:
Lancer-class servant from [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The [[alonso quixano|eponymous protagonist]] from the [[don quixote (novel)|Spanish novel of the same name]]. 

A day-dreaming and lowly noble who underwent adventures to revive chivalry and serve his country.

He is accompanied by [[sancho (fate)|Sancho Panza]], his squire and partner.

Designed by [[Murayama Ryota]] and voiced by [[Tobita Nobuo]].

title: sancho_panza
body:
[b]Sancho Panza[/b] ([b]Sancho "Belly"[/b]) is a character from [[Don Quixote (novel)|]].

He is a small, lower-class and uncultured hairy [[fat]] man who is [[Alonso Quixano]]'s unwilling squire and sidekick.

title: man_of_la_mancha
body:
[quote][i]"To dream the impossible dream
To fight the unbeatable foe
To bear with unbearable sorrow
To run where the brave dare not go..."[/i] - A fragment from [b]The Impossible Dream[/b] by "Andy Williams":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Andy_Williams, main theme of the movie.[/quote]

A 1972 theatrical musical film adaptation of a 1965 musical play based on the novel [[Don Quixote (novel)|]]. It stars "Peter O'Toole":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_O%27Toole as [[Alonso Quixano]], "Sophia Loren":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sophia_Loren as [[Dulcinea del Toboso]] and "James Coco":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Coco as [[Sancho Panza]].

h4. See also
* "Official Trailer":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q-FRZcQ4qVE

* [[Don Quixote (Project MOON)]]

title: rocinante
body:
[b]Rocinante[/b] ([[spanish_text|Spanish]] pronunciation: [roθiˈnante]) is [[alonso quixano|Don Quijote]]'s horse in the two-part 1605/1615 novel [[Don Quixote (novel)|]] by Miguel de Cervantes. 

In many ways, Rocinante is not only his [[horse]], but also his double; like Don Quijote, he is awkward, skinny, past his prime, and engaged in a task beyond his capacities.

title: spanish_text
body:
The image contains text written in the Spanish language.

Spanish is the language of the European country of [[Spain]] (where it originated) as well as several Latin American countries like [[Mexico]], [[Argentina]], [[Colombia]], [[Venezuela]], [[Cuba]], [[Chile]], [[Peru]], etc. Also used in the East Asian country of The [[Philippines]].

title: princess_royale
body:
An illustration contest, themed on battle heroines in mythologies and fairy tales, held by Pixiv and 2.5-Jigen TV internet television company from October to November 2012. 

Like many Pixiv contests, non-winning entries were often taken down by artists after the contest period ended, leaving Danbooru and similar archive sites as one of the only places preserving the works.

h4. Contest Details
The contest ran from October 11 to November 28, 2012. Entries were tagged with プリンセスロワイヤルイラストコンテスト. 
The goal was to "draw an original fairy tale or mythologically-themed heroine in a modern, fantasy, or even science fiction setting. Be sure to include their trademark “battle” style (e.g. superpower or weapons)!" "[1]":[/wiki_pages/40514#dtext-external-links]

For a given character, multiple winners could be selected.


h4. Contest Results 
Contest results were announced on 2012-12-19. There were 3068 people who entered. Winners received a "2.5 Dimension TV Award", which meant ¥50,000 prize money. While the original announcement said 20 or more winners would be selected, in fact 50 winners were selected:

title: nakahara_masaru
body:
Main character of [[Bacchikoi!]]. He is one of the two love interests the player ([[Kanada Toshu]]) can pursue.

He is Yakyusha Academy baseball club's captain. Alongide baseball, Masaru can also play the piano, as he was taught by his mother, who was deceased. His mother died due to terminal illness, for which his family tried to collect and save money to cure, which resulted in his family becoming completely bankrupt and entering many debts. He also failed many exams at his school, which almost led him to lose his scholarship and leave the baseball club.

title: aoi_(itsuki)
body:
碧 (あおい) ~雪山の化け上手 (A Proficient Shapeshifter in a Snowy Mountain)~

An [[original]] [[Touhou]] character by [[Kitsunetsuki Itsuki]].

She has [[blue hair]] with a [[single_braid|braid]], [[blue eyes]],  red [[facial mark|facial marks]], a white [[fox tail]] and [[fox ears]].

In July, 2009, [[Senpii]] created a faux [[Touhou]]-style music for a fictional Stage 1~2 Boss: "悪戯白狐罷り通る":http://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm7643631 ([i]Itazura Shiro-Gitsune Makari Tooru[/i], "A Mischievous White Fox is Going Her Own Way").

Some artists made [[original]] characters inspired by it:

* [[Fukunomiya Koko (kuromiya)|]] by [[Kuromiya]]
* "Hisame Mizore":http://www.pixiv.net/member_illust.php?mode=medium&illust_id=34285742 by [[Kureha Xiao]]
* [[mikado_(senpii)|Mikado]] (白柳木美門) by [[Senpii]] himself

All of them are (partially-)white [[kitsune]] girls. They are sometimes regarded as siblings. They can be considered either as [[Touhou]] [[original|originals]] or as pure [[original]] characters, depending on the situation.

title: plant
body:
Living organisms belonging to the kingdom Plantae. 
Though they are living, plants lack the power of locomotion due to them being a rooted structure.

If you are looking for industrial plant, it goes under the name of [[factory]]. For the Nuclear Throne character see [[plant (nuclear throne)]].

title: nene_nene
body:
Nene Nene (literally, "Root-sound Nene") is an [[UTAU]]LOID female as a singing [[plant girl]]. She was made by Musumesaibou-P, and drawn by [[Tokita (jyabarachan)|]].

Her official hairstyle is "fake [[bob cut]]" in a broad sense. She wears [[serafuku]] and [[headphones]]. And she has a flower[[pot]] as optional accessories. She is characterized with a big [[flower]] of her right wrist, and her lower body which has [[plant roots]] instead of her feet. She can move by crawling with her roots. Her catchphrase is "the singing voice crawling on the ground".

Her flower has the function of a [[speaker]], and her mouth has the function of an audio-jack. When she sings a song, she connects a cord to her flower and holds the audio-plug of the cord in her mouth. She likes little girls and dislikes insects.

h4.See also

* [[UTAU]]
* [[monster girl]] tag

h4. External links

* "Official page":http://knee.iinaa.net/nenenene.html
* "Official themesong (Youtube)":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dC8vPYhgDjM

title: girl_staring_at_guy's_chest_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originally featuring a girl staring at a man's pectoral muscle, seeming impressed by its size.

The image became a popular template among the [[bara]] community, in which the format is switched into two [[muscular male|muscular men]], with one looking at the other's large pectoral muscle, either in envy or in awe. Also occasionally used in a similar manner with female [[breast envy]] memes.

h4. External link

* "Know Your Meme: Girl staring at guy's chest":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/girl-staring-at-guys-chest]

title: xiphos_(sword)
body:
The [b]Xiphos[/b] (Ancient Greek: (το) ξίφος) is a leaf-shaped double-edged, single-handed short [[sword]] used by the ancient Greek [[hoplite]] warriors. 

It was always a secondary battlefield weapon for the Greek armies after the [[spear]] (their main weapon), used only when the spear was lost in battle.

h4. See also

* [[300 (movie)|]]
* [[Leonidas i]]
* [[Aspis]]

title: this_is_sparta
body:
An internet [[meme]] from the movie [[300 (movie)|]] said by the character [[Leonidas i]], the King of Sparta. In the scene it originated from, a Persian messenger asks King Leonidas for a tribute of earth and water, as a token of Sparta's submission to Persia. In response, Leonidas draws his sword and points it at the messenger and forces the messenger toward the ledge of a deep well. The messenger tells Leonidas "That this is blasphemy. This is madness!" To which Leonidas responds with "Madness? This is Sparta!" and kicks the Persian messenger into the well. 

h4. See also

* "External Link - YouTube: This is Sparta. Full Scene":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QkWS9PiXekE

title: oracle_(ancient_greece)
body:
In the ancient Greek culture an [b]Oracle[/b] was a holy person who became [[drugged]] by inhaling the fumes from sacred caves or rock formations, or by smoking and consuming ritual herbs, mushrooms or other natural [[drugs]].

This state supposedly enabled these people to communicate with the Gods and to see events in the far distant future.

h4. See also

* [[300 (movie)|]]  
* [[Pythia]]

body:
A reoccurring demon in the [[Shin Megami Tensei]] franchise. The standard version resembles a white male lion with a serpent's tail.

Cerberus is also the Persona of [[Koromaru (persona)|]] in [[Persona 3]].  There, he resembles a three-headed [[dobermann]] with pitchforks for feet.

title: final_fantasy_xi
body:
The eleventh in a series of popular role-playing games by Square Enix Co., Ltd. The first in the series to go online, it is Square Enix's entry into the MMORPG market. It was first released on the Sony PlayStation 2 system in 2002 in Japan, then released in North America for the PC in 2003. It was re-released for the Microsoft Xbox 360 system in 2004. 

Being an MMORPG, there are no central characters, discounting [[adventurer (ff11)|the player]] themselves in a meta sense, but the numerous races and job classes are represented on Danbooru.

title: command_&_conquer:_tiberian_sun
body:
[b]Command & Conquer: Tiberian Sun[/b] is a 1999 real-time strategy [[video game]] developed by Westwood Studios, published by [[Electronic Arts]], and released exclusively for Microsoft Windows on August 27, 1999. 

The game is the sequel to the 1995 game [[Command and Conquer]]. It featured new semi-3D graphics, a more futuristic [[science fiction]] setting, and new gameplay features such as vehicles capable of hovering or burrowing. 

The main story of the game focuses on a second war between the UN-backed [[Global Defense Initiative]] (GDI) and the cult-like [[Brotherhood of Nod]], both seeking to rule over an [[earth_(planet)|Earth]] which is undergoing rapid ecological collapse.

Tiberian Sun was one of the most anticipated games of 1999. Its development suffered numerous delays, with several features being cut before release. However, it was a commercial success and received positive reviews from critics, despite some of the technical bugs in the game. The dark atmosphere, foreboding soundtrack, and slow paced gameplay of Tiberian Sun received a mixed reception from fans upon release, although have earned it a cult following since. Its story of a military-industrial complex preoccupied with [[terrorism]] rather than environmental failure has been hailed as a metaphor for modern times. 

Several additional features were added to the game with the Firestorm expansion pack, including new units and a multiplayer global war mode. The game was later succeeded by the 2007 sequel [[command & conquer: tiberium wars|Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars]], and was later licensed by Electronic Arts as freeware on February 12, 2010.

title: command_&_conquer:_tiberium_wars
body:
[b][i]Command & Conquer 3: Tiberium Wars[/i][/b] is a 2007 [[science fiction]] real-time strategy [[video game]] developed and published by [[Electronic Arts]] for [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Mac OS X]] and [[Xbox 360]] platforms, and released internationally in March 2007.

The game is a direct sequel to the 1999 game [[Command and Conquer: Tiberian Sun]], and takes place roughly seventeen years after the game's expansion pack Firestorm, in which Tiberium has grown to become a considerable threat to the planet, leading to the world's political borders and territories being remade into zones denoting the level of contamination by the alien substance. 

The game's story sees the [[Global Defense Initiative]] and the [[Brotherhood of Nod]] engage in a new global conflict, this time as major superpowers, only for the war to attract the attention of a new extraterrestrial faction known as the Scrin, which attacks both sides while harvesting Tiberium for its own purpose.

The game brought about several changes in gameplay, some introduced in [[Command and Conquer: Red Alert 2]], including garrisonable structures, neutral tech buildings, unit upgrades and veteran levels, and special powers unique for each playable faction. Other modes include a skirmish battle mode and multiplayer games.

The game received favorable reviews, and proved a commercial success following its launch, with a stand-alone expansion pack released a year later on March 24, 2008, titled Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath.

title: command_&_conquer:_generals
body:
A real-time strategy video game developed by [[electronic_arts|EA Pacific]] and released in February 2003. 

It is set in the near future, relative to the game's release date, using technology that is either existent, in development, or theorized. The game features a conflict between the [[global_liberation_army|Global Liberation Army]] (GLA), an organization resembling a [[terrorist]] group, and the superpowers of the [[China|People’s Republic of China]] (China) and the [[united_states|United States of America]] (USA). 

The game operates in a similar manner to other titles in the [[Command and Conquer|Command & Conquer]] series, where players construct bases, train units, acquire resources on one of the game's maps to fund their operations, and then defeat their opponents by eliminating their bases and armies. It is the first Command & Conquer RTS game to use 3D graphics in-game. The game takes place in an entirely separate continuity that is completely unrelated to the [[command & conquer: red alert 2|Red Alert]] universe or the [[Command and Conquer: Tiberian Sun|Tiberium]] universe.

An expansion pack titled [i]"Command & Conquer: Generals – Zero Hour":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Command_&_Conquer:_Generals_%E2%80%93_Zero_Hour][/i] was released in September 2003, adding several new abilities and units to each side, and a new mode of play called Generals' Challenge, along with a lot more changes, new features and bug/glitch fixes.

The series has received controversy from media watchdogs due to its national stereotyping and the ability to play as a terrorist-like organization, particularly during the height of the "War on Terror":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/War_on_terror. Longtime Command & Conquer fans also objected to the association of their franchise with a game that resembled other real-time strategy games more than traditional Command & Conquer gameplay. 

Despite this, the game received positive reviews from fans and critics for its solid and action-packed gameplay, as well as receiving praise for the humorous and memorable voicelines for many of its units. It has since gained a cult following, with fans of the series continuing to develop mods that change the gameplay significantly.


h4. See Also
* [[Command and Conquer]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Command & Conquer: Generals":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Command_%26_Conquer:_Generals]

title: command_&_conquer:_red_alert_3
body:
The third main entry (i.e. not counting expansion packs) in the [[Command and Conquer]] Red Alert series.

Plot: The Soviets, who were losing WWIII, used their experimental time machine to travel back in time to remove Einstein from the time stream. They succeed, but in doing so merely made the situation more complex by giving into existence the Empire of the Rising Sun. Thus in this new timeline three factions (Allies, Soviets, and Empire) wages war for the dominance of the world.

Gameplay: continuing the trend of the previous game of the series in more cartoony aesthetics while the gameplay shifted away from macromanaging of resources & production to that of micromanaging special abilities of individual units, of which every single unit has a secondary ability of some kind.

Other: notable for a lot of celebrity actors and actresses appearing in the FMV cutscenes.

h4. Characters
* [[Natasha Volkova]]

title: apocalypse_tank_(red_alert_2)
body: Superheavy soviet tank in [[command & conquer: red alert 2|Red Alert 2]], probably the successor of the [[Mammoth tank (c&c)|]] of the previous game. Much like its predecessor, it's slower than most tanks, it boasts twin heavy cannons and missiles, which can fire at aircraft, making it rather well rounded as a unit. Would be succeeded by the [[Apocalypse tank (red alert 3)|]] in Red Alert 3.

title: yanai_ichiru
body:
Main character of [[Bacchikoi!]]. He is one of the two love interests the player ([[Kanada Toshu]]) can pursue.

He is the son of Yanai Keiji, the president of Yakyusha Academy who is also a business partner of Saji Hideaki, [[Saji Tomoka]]'s father and monarch of one of the richest families in the game. He was set to an arranged marriage between him and [[Saji Tomoka]] by their parents to bring the families closer.
He skips classes often due to his father's position. Despite this, he is deemed as a genius and achieves good grades at his school and is seen with insurmountable potential.

title: green_tea_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21093235

Voice of [[Yatadera Narumi]] in [[Cookie (touhou)|Zapper☆]] and specifically Narumi in nearly every voice drama she has acted in, and director of Gyudon☆. Started posting MADs of [[JOKER (cookie)|]] and [[Akanuma]] too eventually working with JOKER on Gyudon☆. Also seemed to be partially multilingual, translating a few Chinese voice dramas and reaching out to [[Maru (cookie)|]] and [[Web (cookie)|]]. Started slowing down posting in August 2020 and completely disappeared in 2023, with some guessing that she might have died of an unknown chronic disease she had.

Her involvement in nearly every part of both the Cookie and [[Manatsu no yo no Inmu|Inmu]] communities made her stand out more than most of the other voice actresses. Her preference for heterosexual pairings was considered extremely unusual and she became one of the most divisive creators on the entirety of NicoNico. She was sent a dick pic in twitter DMs and then proceeded to grade it so she is sometimes drawn as obsessed with dicks or generally lewd.

title: sasorihime_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21093157
* !asset #21093159

Voice of [[Alice Margatroid]] in [[Cookie (touhou)|Zapper☆]] and a decently large amount of other voice dramas. She was initially well respected for being fairly good acting, singing, and talking. However, her avatar became more known when she started issuing takedowns on MADs that she didn't like. When the 2018 Hokkaido Eastern Iburi earthquake happened, people created MADs to see if she would take them down to see if she was still alive. Her name means [[Scorpion]] Princess so fans like to draw her as an angry scorpion, stinging everyone.

title: bacchikoi!
body:
[[Yaoi]] [[visual novel]] from [[BlackMonkey Pro]], released on September 6th, 2014.

The main story follows a Yakyusha Academy transfer student [[Kanada Toshu]], who joins it's baseball club and plays it alongside [[Nakahara Masaru]], the club's captain, and [[Yanai Ichiru]], both of which are potential love interests in the main game.

Bacchikoi!'s expansion pack - "Bacchikoi Expansion Pack", released in July 11th, 2015, features different stories in the same timeline as the original game, focusing more on Yakyusha's baseball club captain [[Tadano Genji]], [[Nakahara Masaru|Masaru]] and [[Yanai Ichiru|Ichiru]] rather than [[Kanada Toshu|Toshu]]. The expansion pack does not offer players any choice and can only scroll through the single variant story featured in the expansion pack.

h1. Characters
See [[List of Bacchikoi! characters]]

body:
* !asset #21092878

Voice of [[Hakurei Reimu]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Zapper☆]] and probably Viet Cong☆. Identifiable by her [[brown hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], missing frills on both her [[hair bow]] and [[hair tubes]], and the [[yellow halo]] above her head. Disappeared from in the internet in May 2018.

While orginally a minor character due to Zapper mostly failing, she slowly started gaining popularity in 2019 after appearing in a few [[Nyon (cookie)|NYN]][[Ichigo (cookie)|ICG]] sketches. A misreading of her name as Yoshimi led to her saying it in some fan works.

title: web_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21092188
* !asset #21092192

Voice of [[Alice Margatroid]] and [[Inubashiri Momiji]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Easter☆]], [[Kirisame Marisa]] and [[Moriya Suwako]] in Turkey☆, [[Hakurei Reimu]] and [[Cirno]] and [[Luna Child]] in Half-life☆, and Momiji in Gyudon☆. An American voice actress who lives in the state of Georgia, she is mostly drawn as Alice or "Miji". Highly regarded for her upbeat and energetic voice acting. Now active as the [[virtual youtuber]] [[Webemez]].

Being the main character of Easter☆ combined with the novelty of the first fully English Cookie voice drama made her the popular star in any following MADs and remixes. Her lines "Oh, no!", "Don't worry!", "Yayyyyyy", "What a wonderful morning", and "Oh wow" are simple enough for most Japanese users to understand so are used the most often. Her depiction of Miji completed the Cerberus with [[INU (cookie)|]] and [[Kuso Inu (cookie)|]]. A sub-meme of her as a [[ninja]] got popular for some reason.

title: v2_assault-buster_gundam
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993-1994.

[b]LM314V23/24 Assault-Buster Gundam[/b]

The almost invincible configuration of the [[V2 Gundam]] [[mobile suit]]. Equipped with the Assault Package, consisting of add-on reactive armor, I-Field generators on the shoulders, a pair of Variable Speed Beam Rifles on the hips, and a mega beam rifle, and the Buster Package, fitting a mega beam cannon, beam spray pod, and micro-missile launchers, the V2's tremendous base combat capabilities are expanded both offensively and defensively, enabling the unit to fight with the combat effectiveness of an entire squad. The full configuration was only briefly deployed by [[Uso Ewin]] before an accurate shot by [[Katejina Loos]] destroyed the Buster add-on parts.
other_names: LM314V23/24V2アサルトバスターガンダム
V2アサルトバスターガンダム

body: [b]Emergence[/b] ([i]Henshin[/i] in Japanese), also known as [b]Metamorphosis[/b], is an infamous, controversial eromanga created by [[shindol]], best known for its disturbing storyline and its notoriously tragic ending. It's often referred to by the number "[b]177013[/b]" in reference to its formerly assigned page number on the hentai database [[nhentai|nhentai.net]].

title: hisaka_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21091648
* !asset #21092010: HSKY

Voice of [[Remilia Scarlet]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Clownpiece☆]]. Identifiable by her [[purple eyes]] and [[purple hair]] and never smiling. Usually animated extremely oddly, with a focus on [[body horror]]. Became well known for documenting her depressing life on twitter but has mostly been positive recently.

She's elaborated on a few different incidents in her life that are depicted in art:
* She eats [[taiyaki]] from the center first
* She drew a picture of [[Izayoi Sakuya]] that looked like it had tentacles for arms. This Sakuya is called Hisakuya.
* [[Dorasiro (cookie)|]]: A male fan of hers, a few years older than her. Talked with her during her depressive episodes. 
* Her brother poured boiling water on her
* A cat attacked her on the way home from shopping and stole her fish
* She's had multiple minor fractures
* A random boy beat her with a baseball bat
* She dropped the baton during a relay race and was bullied for days
* Her friend strangles her regularly

Disappeared after the voice drama, whereabouts unknown.

title: tearju_lunatique
body:
A character featured in both [[black_cat_(series)|Black Cat]] and [[To LOVE-Ru Darkness]], sharing the same name and looks in both. Tearju wears [[glasses]], has [[very long hair|very long]] [[blonde hair]] and [[green eyes]].

In Black Cat, she was the lead researcher on the nanotechnology project that created [[eve_(black_cat)|Eve]], having used her own DNA as a base.

In To Love Ru, she is a new teacher at [[Yuuki Rito]]'s school and an old friend of [[Mikado Ryouko]].  [spoiler]Is also a former biologist and delivered the genes for the creation of [[Konjiki no Yami]]. In other words, she is Yami's "mother".[/spoiler]
other_names: ティアーユ・ルナティーク

title: yurina_amado
body:
* !asset #21091297
* !asset #21091298

Voice of [[Hata-tan_(rui_(hershe))|Hata-tan]] ([[Himekaidou Hatate]]) in [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso Inu☆]] and [[Kirisame Marisa]] in Gorgonzola☆. Also has done a few voices for the [[Touhou M-1 Grand Prix]]. Fairly standard appearance as Hata-tan, identifiable by her giant hat with a [[green bow]] as Marisa. Goes by a different name for every voice drama she does, and even the [[Shiriri (cookie)|director of Gorgonzola]] didn't know it was her. Knew [[Paseri (cookie)|]] before either of them were voice actresses. Less active since getting married and having a daughter in 2020.

title: kuso_inu_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21091232
* !asset #21091233

Voice of [[Inubashiri Momiji]] and [[Cirno]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Kuso Inu☆]]. Identifiable by her [[shaded face]], [[floppy ears]], and [[evil smile]]. Like [[Jigen (cookie)|]], her screen name is Shukuren but everyone calls her Kuso Inu. One of the most convincing voice actresses, she became the most popular of the voice drama/doujin. 

Her line "Isn't free food received without having to work delicious? Haha, I wonder if Momiji would be able to eat it...” is her most famous. Usually appears as a bully in fan art. Later would form the Cerberus with [[INU (cookie)|]] and [[Web (cookie)|Miji]], and the most vocal member as INU has no lines and Miji only speaks English.

title: curly_brace
body:
Heroine of [[Doukutsu Monogatari]]. Following her own stranding and subsequent amnesia, she takes a pack of [[mimiga]] children under her ward. With her trusty machine gun, and the aid of [[Quote (doukutsu monogatari)|]], she vows to protect them at all costs, contrary to her original mission...

She has [[blue eyes]], [[white skin]], [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]], and [[robot ears]]. She wears a [[red tank top|red]] [[crop top|cropped]] [[tank top]] that exposes [[midriff]], and [[red pants]]. She is often depicted wearing or holding [[green panties]] in reference to a secret easter egg.

title: kirby_and_the_amazing_mirror
body:
The second main-series Kirby game on the [[Game Boy Advance]] after [[Kirby: Nightmare in Dream Land]]. It introduces four-player co-op to the series and appears to try to combine the slower pace of [[Kirby's Adventure]] with the varied movesets of copy abilities ala [[Kirby Super Star]].

High above Dream Land, there is a [[dimension mirror|]] that acts as a portal to the Mirror World. One day, the Mirror World is attacked by a dark force and [[Meta Knight]] sets out to investigate.

Meanwhile, [[Kirby]] is out strolling in the spring breeze when [[Dark Meta Knight]] suddenly attacks him, splitting him into four. Confused, Kirby and his new clones follow the attacker to the Mirror World.

h4. Characters

* [[Shadow Kirby]]
* King Golem
* [[Moley]]
* [[Kracko]]
* [[Mega Titan]]
* [[Gobbler (kirby)|]]
* [[Wiz (kirby)|]]
* [[Master Hand]] and [[Crazy Hand]]
* [[Dark Meta Knight]]
* [[Dark Mind]]
other_names: 星のカービィ鏡の大迷宮

title: green_little_pig_(sinoalice)
body:
One of the Three Little Pig [[sisters]]. The three have very similar designs but there exists several distinguishable traits. She is the one with a [[plump]] body, bangs parted to the right and [[double bun]]. She is associated with the color green.

The Three Little Pigs act as a single character in gameplay, sharing almost all of their character sprites. The one in the center receives a new art with each skin like other characters, while the two on the back follows a pose template and only have their clothes changed. The [[Red Little Pig (sinoalice)|]] is almost always the "central character":/posts/7175966, but the Green Little Pigs has received a "central sprite":/posts/3736358 as well as a "solo sprite":/posts/3941679.

h4. See also

* [[Blue Little Pig (sinoalice)|]]
* [[Red Little Pig (sinoalice)|]]
other_names: 三匹の子豚(シノアリス)

The Three Little Pigs act as a single character in gameplay, sharing almost all of their character sprites. The one in the center receives a new art with each skin like other characters, while the two on the back follows a pose template and only have their clothes changed. The [[Red Little Pig (sinoalice)|]] is almost always the "central character":/posts/7175966, but the Blue Little Pigs has received three "central sprites":/posts/3834190 as well as a "solo sprite":/posts/7176167.

title: inconspicuous_crypto
body:
A [[official alternate costume|legendary skin]] for [[Crypto (Apex legends)|]] in [[Apex Legends]], based on his civilian appearance from before he joined the Apex Games, and released during Season 9's Genesis collection event. In this skin, Crypto's hair is no longer parted and he wears [[sunglasses]] and a large [[beige jacket]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]] with a [[blue necktie]] and [[grey pants]] with a [[brown belt]].

This tag should not be used for posts that simply picture a younger, pre-Apex Crypto as he appears in supplementary materials, instead it should be used for posts directly featuring the in-game skin

h4. Correct examples
These posts depict the actual in-game skin.
* !post #4629613
* !post #5014606

h4. Incorrect examples
These posts depict a younger Crypto based on his appearance in cinematics and other supplementary material.
* !post #5006948
* !post #4483998
* !post #4433947

title: elmeth
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979.

[b]MAN-08 Elmeth[/b]

A massive Newtype use [[mobile armor]] developed by the Principality of [[Zeon]] in cooperation with the Flanagan Research Institute. It carried an oversized, early experimental Psycommu system, allowing its pilot to control the lethal [[bit_(gundam)|"bit"]] remote weapons, as well as two 90° foward mounted [[beam_cannon|mega-particle guns]]. 

[spoilers]It was piloted by [[Lalah Sune]].[/spoilers]

h4.See also
* [[Psyco Gundam]] - A later mecha developed using the same giant Psycommu system.

title: unforgiven_(le_sserafim)
body:
A 2023 song by [[LE SSERAFIM]]. The song was made in collaboration with Nile Rodgers, and is the leading single from their album of the same name. Particularly notable for sampling the theme of [[The Good The Bad and The Ugly|The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly]].

A Japanese translated version of the song was released later in 2023, featuring additional vocals by [[Ado (utaite)|]].

title: mineva_lao_zabi
body:
A fictional female character from the [[Gundam]] series

She first appears in [i][[Zeta Gundam]][/i] and [i][[Gundam ZZ]][/i] (Introduced briefly in [I][[Mobile Suit Gundam]][/i] as an infant). Mineva is the daughter of [[Dozle Zabi]] and the last surviving member of Zabi's royal family. As such she is the official leader of [[Neo Zeon]], but all actual power is held by her regent, [[Haman Karn]].

Later, [spoilers]she serves as the heroine in [[Gundam Unicorn]] under the name [[Audrey Burne]].[/spoilers]

title: puffing_up
body:
An animal puffing up its body as a defense mechanism in a threatening situation in order to appear larger in size, to signal defensive aggression towards the enemy. In mammals, this is usually done alongside a [[bent back]].

Often accompanied by [[hissing]]. Though unlike hissing which is an offensive move almost always shown as a form of threat or [[angry|anger]], puffing up can be seen on other occasions such as [[scared|fear]] or [[surprised|shock]].

h4. See also

* [[cats are scared of cucumbers (meme)]]

title: maki_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21049859
* !asset #21049865

Director of the second trilogy of [[cookie (touhou)|Cookie☆]] voice dramas (Halloween☆, Nabe☆, and Myorenji☆), semi-professional [[League of Legends]] player. Following the conclusion of [[Taisa (cookie)|]]'s Cookie Season 2, there was excitement for who next would be taking their chances directing a series of voice dramas. Maki was hyped to be the next big star, however all three of his voice dramas flopped for being too boring in both the voice drama itself and any controversy. Maki's legacy is largely as a failed director, and the fear of being the next Maki became a running theme in following voice dramas.

title: game_club_project
body:
A group of [[Virtual YouTuber]]s operated by Unlimited (now known as Brave Group) that started activity on 6 March 2018. 

In April 2019, there was a controversy regarding an internal problem between the voices portraying the club members and the management, leading to them being fired. They later resumed their activities on 19 April after a discussion among the voices and managements, but towards the end of 2019, they were all replaced with a new set of voices causing a negative reception that disbanded the group in February 2021.

Eventually Kaede, Ryou, Miria, and Cocoa's original voices moved [[Yuzuriha Honami|on]] [[Yuugasaki Umi|to]] [[Hanagumo Kuyuri|other]] "projects":[https://www.youtube.com/@AliAofficial], Haruto similarly so. Cocoa's new voice actor was transferred off the project to concentrate on her virtual artist career, while Miria's new voice actor would be transferred to a new agency, Highway Star, along with fellow Unlimited coworker [[Claire Cruller]]. 

h4. Characters

title: mars_(cookie)
body:
* !asset #21017679

Voice of [[Kirisame Marisa]] in [[cookie_(touhou)|Cookie☆☆ S1]] and [[Hong Meiling]] Cookie☆☆ S2. Usually drawn in her [[black dress]] from Curiosities of Lotus Asia and with [[messy hair]] and [[bags under eyes|bags under]] her [[green eyes]]. Known for her very low and rough voice and her mumbling speech pattern. She was also in a [[yuri|lesbian]] relationship with Cookie☆☆'s director [[Taisa (cookie)|]] after they met at a voice acting school, but they had already broken up by the time Cookie☆☆ S3 aired. Was a massive [[Pokemon]] fan, her favorites being [[Tyranitar]] and [[Scizor]].

title: crew_neck
body:
A type of [[shirt]], [[sweater]], [[dress]], or other top with a round, close-fitting neckline. The crew neck gets its name from its association with rowing teams and other athletic crews who originally wore this style of shirt.

h4. Characteristics:

* [b]Shape:[/b] The defining feature of a crew neck is its round, circular neckline. It does not have a collar and is typically higher than other necklines, such as a [[V-neck]] or [[scoop neck]].
* [b]Fit:[/b] The neckline sits snugly around the base of the neck without any plunging or revealing cuts.

h4. Related Tags:
* [[V-neck]]: For garments with a V-shaped neckline.
* [[scoop neck]]: For garments with a wide, rounded neckline that is lower than a crew neck.
* [[turtleneck]]: For garments with a high, close-fitting collar that covers the neck.
